nodes.title: Sekhang Khyungkar Tenpa Gyatso Ling Introduction

nodes.body: gSas khang Khyung dkar bstan pa rgya mtsho gling
nodes.title: 1. Name

nodes.body: There are thirty-two tantric practitioners in the temple.
nodes.title: 5. Number of practitioners

nodes.body: Kun bzang and Tshe dbang occur alternately on the 10th of each month and dBal gsas on the 29th of each month. Kung bzang, the sbyin sreg ritual of the sNang srid zhi ba chen mo and sPyi ’dul from the 17th to the 24th day of the 1st month. Khro bo and Pho nya gze ma from the 22nd to the 30th day of the 3rd month. A five-day ritual dedicated to dBal gsas at a suitable time in the 5th month.
nodes.title: 8 / 9. Rituals

nodes.body: Four villages: mKhar nang with thirty-one families, dGar ba with twenty-three families, Nyin skor with eleven families and sDong skam with twenty-four families (five hundred and sixty people altogether).
nodes.title: 12. Local community

nodes.body: The la btsas, whose name is unknown, is located 1 km from the temple and propitiated on the 11th day of the 4th month. The local people say that it was built by unidentified Bonpo tantric practitioners in the remote past.
nodes.title: 13. Local festivals
14. Economic occupation of the local people
